text: @ElleLewis6 Not being a big comic reader, I had no idea! I learn about all this stuff from people discussing the movies/shows.
@ElleLewis6 Wait, is she Hellcat?
@ElleLewis6 I'm also really looking forward to the Luke Cage show, which is next year, I think.
@ElleLewis6 I don't know that it's my favorite of all time, mostly because of the pacing. But I still really enjoyed it.
Though I felt like the pacing needed something more, overall I was very satisfied w/ the exploration of PTSD, what it is to be a hero, etc.
I loved the complications of Malcolm. A lot of interesting layers there that I can't discuss without getting into spoilers.
No spoilers here, of course! Would love to hear what you all think of it, particularly of characters Malcom & Luke Cage.

Social media CAN change things. Creates awareness. @LynnMelnick #WeNeedDiverseBooks
Be aware! Once you start counting, you can't stop. It's everywhere, men outnumbering women in ads, media. @LynnMelnick #WeNeedDiverseBooks
In bookstores, change comes one book at a time by raving about a good book! #WeNeedDiverseBooks
What can readers do? Buy, share, recommend! Take diverse books to school (sharing reading time etc). #WeNeedDiverseBooks
.@FirstBook also works on providing shelf stable food and other necessities so kids can have those needs met so they can learn.
Ask your booksellers and librarians to carry more diverse books.--@LynnMelnick
Remember that access is not always available to all audiences. @FirstBook focuses on filling that gap. #WeNeedDiverseBooks
